title: Sri Lanka rupee at 331/348 to TT dollar
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s commercial banks quoted the rupee at 331/348 for telegraphic transfers on April 28, rising from the previous day, while the secondary market remained mostly inactive, market participants said.
The central bank’s indicative spot was quoted at 340.46 rupees against the US dollar on Tuesday.
Central bank’s telegraphic transfer rates for Tuesday was 333.88/346.5 against the US dollar up from 330.00/342.5 against the US dollar on the previous say.
The secondary markets were completely inactive ahead of the weekly bills auction on Wednesday and a bond auction Thursday, market participants said.
Dealers said there were no active quotes for bond or bill maturities.
Sri Lanka’s debt office is issuing 87.5 billion rupees in bills to be sold in an auction held on Wednesday and a 35 billion in bonds on Thursday.
